result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mai Va Xiong

9:34 AM Defendant Mai Va Xiong not in court.  Attorney Melissa S. Inlow in court for State of Wisconsin. Bench warrant was requested and authorized to be issued on the defendants failure to appear.
Defendant is eligible for PD representation but no one has been secured.
Initial appearance on July 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant shall not be in the presence or possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia, or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a licensed Wisconsin medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.

All parties appeared via Zoom; ADA Anderson appeared on behalf of the State; Defendant appeared, in custody, pro se; Defendant has received a copy of the Complaint; Defendant waives reading of Complaint; Court explains right to an attorney; State requests a $2500 signature bond; Court orders a $2500 signature bond; Court sets IA on 7/26/22 at 9:30 a.m.
